alert.note: Alert for Gloucester (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 6:38PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Gloucester, east central Chester and Delaware Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 638 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Westtown, or near West Chester, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... West Chester, Chester, Yeadon, Westtown, Folcroft, Swarthmore, East Lansdowne, Darby Township, Cheyney, Elam, Trout Lake, Chelsea, Gradyville, Broomall, Newtown Square, Chester Township, Gibbstown, Drexel Hill, Lima and Nether Providence Township. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 10. Interstate 95 in Delaware near mile marker 23. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 13 and 16. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for northern Delaware...southern New Jersey...and southeastern Pennsylvania.
